The HCF (Highest Common Factor) is the largest number that divides both 36 and 48 without a remainder. For these numbers, it is 12.
The LCM (Lowest Common Multiple) is the smallest number that both 12 and 15 can divide into. For these numbers, it is 60.
What is the square root of 144?
The square root of a number is the value that, when multiplied by itself, gives the original number. For 144, the square root is 12 because 12 × 12 = 144.
If the radius of a circle is 7 cm, what is its area?
The formula for the area of a circle is πr². Using π = 22/7 and r = 7, the area is 22/7 × 7 × 7 = 154 cm².
The cube of a number is the result of multiplying it by itself three times. For 3, the cube is 3 × 3 × 3 = 27.
What is the sum of the first 10 natural numbers?
The sum of the first n natural numbers is calculated using the formula n(n+1)/2. For n = 10, the sum is 10 × 11 / 2 = 55.
A train travels 240 km in 3 hours. What is its speed?
Speed is calculated using the formula Speed = Distance / Time. Here, 240/3 = 80 km/h.
Exponentiation means multiplying a number by itself repeatedly. 2⁵ = 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 × 2 = 32.
If the perimeter of a square is 40 cm, what is the side length?
The perimeter of a square is 4 × side. Solving 40 = 4 × side gives side = 10 cm.
A man buys an item for ₹200 and sells it for ₹250. What is his profit percentage?
Profit% = (Profit / Cost Price) × 100. Here, profit = 250 - 200 = ₹50, so profit% = (50/200) × 100 = 25%.
If 3x = 27, what is the value of x?
Divide both sides of the equation by 3: x = 27/3 = 9.
Follow the BODMAS rule: First divide 15 ÷ 3 = 5, then multiply 5 × 2 = 10.
What is the area of a rectangle with length 10 cm and breadth 5 cm?
The formula for the area of a rectangle is length × breadth. Here, 10 × 5 = 50 cm².
If a = 5 and b = 3, what is a² + b²?
a² + b² means squaring a and b, then adding. 5² + 3² = 25 + 9 = 34.
The simple interest on ₹1000 at 5% per annum for 2 years is:
Simple Interest = (P × R × T) / 100. Here, SI = (1000 × 5 × 2) / 100 = ₹100.
What is the sum of the angles in a triangle?
The sum of the angles in any triangle is always 180°.
Find a common denominator (6) and add the fractions: 1/2 + 1/3 = 3/6 + 2/6 = 5/6.
0.25 can be written as 25/100, which simplifies to 1/4.
A number is divisible by 9 if:
The sum of its digits is divisible by 9
The sum of its digits is divisible by 9
If the sum of the digits of a number is divisible by 9, the number itself is divisible by 9.
If the cost price is ₹400 and the selling price is ₹500, what is the profit?
Profit = Selling Price - Cost Price. Here, 500 - 400 = ₹100.
If a train travels at 60 km/h for 4 hours, how far does it travel?
The square root of 81 is 9 because 9 × 9 = 81.
Follow the BODMAS rule: First multiply 2 × 3 = 6, then add 8 + 6 = 14.
Which word does not belong to the group: Apple, Mango, Banana, Carrot?
Carrot is a vegetable, while the others are fruits.
If A is coded as 1, B as 2, C as 3, then what is the code for F?
Each letter corresponds to its position in the alphabet. F is the 6th letter.
All numbers except 9 are prime numbers.
What comes next in the series: 2, 4, 8, 16, ?
The series doubles each time: 2 × 2 = 4, 4 × 2 = 8, and so on.
If CAT is coded as DBU, how is DOG coded?
Each letter is shifted forward by 1 in the alphabet (C → D, A → B, T → U).
In a certain code, TREE is written as UQFF. How is FLOW written?
Each letter is shifted forward by 1 in the alphabet.
Ravi is taller than Rohit but shorter than Amit. Who is the tallest?
Amit is taller than Ravi, and Ravi is taller than Rohit.
If TABLE is coded as GZOVI, how is CHAIR coded?
Each letter is replaced by its opposite in the alphabet (A ↔ Z, B ↔ Y, etc.).
Pointing to a man, Ramesh said, 'His mother is the only daughter of my mother.' How is the man related to Ramesh?
The man’s mother is Ramesh’s only daughter, so the man is Ramesh’s son.
What comes next in the series: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25, ?
The series is squares of natural numbers: 1², 2², 3², and so on.
If P × Q means P is the sister of Q, P + Q means P is the brother of Q, and P - Q means P is the mother of Q, then what does A - B + C mean?
A is the sister of C
A is the mother of C
A is the mother of B and B is the brother of C
A is the sister of B
A is the mother of B and B is the brother of C
A - B means A is the mother of B, and B + C means B is the brother of C.
Find the missing term: ACE, GIK, ___, MOQ
The pattern is skipping one letter each time (A → C → E, G → I → K, etc.).
If B = 2, BAT = 23, and CAT = 24, what is HAT?
Sum of letter positions: H(8) + A(1) + T(20) = 29.
A is the father of B. B is the mother of C. How is A related to C?
A is the grandfather of C because A is B’s father, and B is C’s mother.
What comes next in the series: 5, 10, 20, 40, ?
The series doubles each time: 5 × 2 = 10, 10 × 2 = 20, and so on.
In a certain code, PEAR is written as QFBS. How is LIME written?
Each letter is shifted forward by 1 in the alphabet.
Find the missing term: Z, X, V, T, ?
The pattern is moving backward by 2 letters in the alphabet (Z → X → V → T → R).
Ramesh ranks 9th from the top and 38th from the bottom in a class. How many students are there?
Total students = Top rank + Bottom rank - 1. Here, 9 + 38 - 1 = 46.
If '+' means '-', '-' means '×', '×' means '÷', and '÷' means '+', then what is 6 + 2 × 3?
The pattern is multiplying by increasing numbers: 3 × 2 = 6, 6 × 3 = 18, 18 × 4 = 72, 72 × 5 = 360.
The pattern is doubling and subtracting 1: 15 × 2 - 1 = 31, 31 × 2 - 1 = 63, and so on.
A clock shows 3:15. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands?
Each minute represents 6°, and the hour hand moves 0.5° per minute. The angle is 7.5°.
The pattern is adding consecutive even numbers: 2 + 4 = 6, 6 + 6 = 12, and so on.
The series represents squares of natural numbers: 1², 2², 3², etc.
Which is the odd one out: Circle, Square, Triangle, Rectangle?
Circle is the only shape without straight edges.
Who was the first Governor-General of India?
Warren Hastings was the first Governor-General of India, serving from 1773 to 1785.
In which year did the Battle of Plassey take place?
The Battle of Plassey in 1757 marked the beginning of British rule in India.
Who is known as the 'Iron Man of India'?
Sardar Patel played a key role in unifying India after independence, earning him this title.
Which movement was launched by Mahatma Gandhi in 1942?
The Quit India Movement called for an end to British rule in India.
Who was the founder of the Maurya Empire?
Chandragupta Maurya established the Maurya Empire in 321 BCE.
Who was the last Mughal emperor of India?
Bahadur Shah II was the last Mughal emperor, exiled after the 1857 Revolt.
Which reformer is known as the 'Father of Indian Renaissance'?
He led social reforms like the abolition of Sati and promotion of education.
When did the Jallianwala Bagh massacre take place?
It occurred on April 13, 1919, under General Dyer’s orders.
Who was the first Indian to win a Nobel Prize?
Tagore won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1913 for his work 'Gitanjali.'
Which treaty ended the First Anglo-Maratha War?
The Treaty of Salbai in 1782 restored the status quo between the British and Marathas.
Who led the Revolt of 1857 in Kanpur?
Nana Saheb led the revolt in Kanpur against British rule.
Who was the Viceroy of India at the time of partition in 1947?
Lord Mountbatten oversaw the partition of India in 1947.
Which Sultan of Delhi introduced the token currency system?
He introduced token currency made of copper, which failed miserably.
Who is known as the 'Napoleon of India'?
Samudragupta earned this title for his military conquests and campaigns.
The Brahmo Samaj was established in 1828 to reform Hindu society.
Who was the first Indian Governor-General of independent India?
C. Rajagopalachari served as the last Governor-General of India after independence.
Which act is also known as the Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms?
The 1919 Act introduced diarchy in provincial administration.
Which Indian freedom fighter founded the Azad Hind Fauj?
Subhas Chandra Bose formed the Azad Hind Fauj to fight against British rule.
Who started the Home Rule Movement in India?
Tilak started the Home Rule Movement in 1916 to demand self-rule.
Who introduced the Doctrine of Lapse?
The Doctrine of Lapse was used to annex princely states without heirs.
Who founded the All India Muslim League?
It was founded in 1906 to safeguard Muslim political interests.
Which Mughal emperor built the Taj Mahal?
Shah Jahan built the Taj Mahal in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Who was the first Indian woman to become the President of the Indian National Congress?
Annie Besant became the President of the INC in 1917.
Who authored the book 'India Wins Freedom'?
This autobiography details Azad’s experiences during the freedom struggle.
When was the Indian National Congress founded?
The INC was founded in 1885 by A.O. Hume and other leaders.
What is the value of 0! (zero factorial)?
By definition, 0! equals 1 as it represents an empty product.
